column4: Could somebody help me out with setting up a webcam under Ubuntu? It should be working, but any ideas on how to get ubuntu to recognize that its connected?
you can see logs in dmesg when you plug it in?
would I just go to system messages, or do I use a terminal to see the updates from dmesg
And hold on I'll be right back
is usually just run dmesg in  a terminal before and after plugin in hardware
would I check dmesg from the terminal or from syslogs?
terminal.
command?
[  231.140078] hub 3-0:1.0: unable to enumerate USB device on port 1
did you try other devices on that hib/port?
I know it works
the cam works on other computers? or is the cable bad..
Should work brand new
Sorta
It should work seeing as how its new. Well, sort of.
every usb device should get an address (visible in dmesg) and be seen with lsusb, even if your ubuntu did not have a driver for it. so you have a hardware problem with it right now
could it be because it wasnt officially supposed to work with linux?
I've heard of people getting it to work, but that was under Gentoo, so....
nope. even these devices show up in lsusb and dmesg.
any ideas?
not really
what do you mean? simultaneous downloads? it certainly downloads many packages, one after the other when you install a lot
yes, would a couple of simultaneous downloads be a problem or just a fluke?
that is no problem. it just downloads first and with 2 connections it can be quicker.
